intro: Hesperis inodora var. vrabelyiana, commonly known as the Vrabelyiana sweet rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
